title: Proper substitution of classes for sets

blocks.name: wsbc
blocks.content: Extend wff notation to include the proper substitution of a class for a set. Read this notation as "the proper substitution of class ` A ` for setvar variable ` x ` in wff ` ph ` ".
blocks.origin: prop wff wsbc(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0) { [c0 / s0]w0 }

blocks.name: diff.wsbc.s
diff.wsbc.c
diff.wsbc.w
df-sbc
blocks.content: Define the proper substitution of a class for a set. When ` A ` is a proper class, our definition evaluates to false (see ~ sbcex ). This is somewhat arbitrary: we could have, instead, chosen the conclusion of ~ sbc6 for our definition, whose right-hand side always evaluates to true for proper classes. Our definition also does not produce the same results as discussed in the proof of Theorem 6.6 of [Quine] p. 42 (although Theorem 6.6 itself does hold, as shown by ~ dfsbcq below). For example, if ` A ` is a proper class, Quine's substitution of ` A ` for ` y ` in ` 0 e. y ` evaluates to ` 0 e. A ` rather than our falsehood. (This can be seen by substituting ` A ` , ` y ` , and ` 0 ` for alpha, beta, and gamma in Subcase 1 of Quine's discussion on p. 42.) Unfortunately, Quine's definition requires a recursive syntactic breakdown of ` ph ` , and it does not seem possible to express it with a single closed formula. If we did not want to commit to any specific proper class behavior, we could use this definition _only_ to prove theorem ~ dfsbcq , which holds for both our definition and Quine's, and from which we can derive a weaker version of ~ df-sbc in the form of ~ sbc8g . However, the behavior of Quine's definition at proper classes is similarly arbitrary, and for practical reasons (to avoid having to prove sethood of ` A ` in every use of this definition) we allow direct reference to ~ df-sbc and assert that ` [. A / x ]. ph ` is always false when ` A ` is a proper class. The theorem ~ sbc2or shows the apparently "strongest" statement we can make regarding behavior at proper classes if we start from ~ dfsbcq . The related definition ~ df-csb defines proper substitution into a class variable (as opposed to a wff variable). (Contributed by NM, 14-Apr-1995.) (Revised by NM, 25-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: dfsbcq
blocks.content: Proper substitution of a class for a set in a wff given equal classes. This is the essence of the sixth axiom of Frege, specifically Proposition 52 of [Frege1879] p. 50. This theorem, which is similar to Theorem 6.7 of [Quine] p. 42 and holds under both our definition and Quine's, provides us with a weak definition of the proper substitution of a class for a set. Since our ~ df-sbc does not result in the same behavior as Quine's for proper classes, if we wished to avoid conflict with Quine's definition we could start with this theorem and ~ dfsbcq2 instead of ~ df-sbc . ( ~ dfsbcq2 is needed because unlike Quine we do not overload the ~ df-sb syntax.) As a consequence of these theorems, we can derive ~ sbc8g , which is a weaker version of ~ df-sbc that leaves substitution undefined when ` A ` is a proper class. However, it is often a nuisance to have to prove the sethood hypothesis of ~ sbc8g , so we will allow direct use of ~ df-sbc after theorem ~ sbc2or below. Proper substitution with a proper class is rarely needed, and when it is, we can simply use the expansion of Quine's definition. (Contributed by NM, 14-Apr-1995.)

blocks.name: dfsbcq2
blocks.content: This theorem, which is similar to Theorem 6.7 of [Quine] p. 42 and holds under both our definition and Quine's, relates logic substitution ~ df-sb and substitution for class variables ~ df-sbc . Unlike Quine, we use a different syntax for each in order to avoid overloading it. See remarks in ~ dfsbcq . (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: sbsbc
blocks.content: Show that ~ df-sb and ~ df-sbc are equivalent when the class term ` A ` in ~ df-sbc is a setvar variable. This theorem lets us reuse theorems based on ~ df-sb for proofs involving ~ df-sbc . (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-2016.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: sbc8g
blocks.content: This is the closest we can get to ~ df-sbc if we start from ~ dfsbcq (see its comments) and ~ dfsbcq2 . (Contributed by NM, 18-Nov-2008.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 29-Jun-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbc8g(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0))))
} = {
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, c1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w0), wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s0, w0)))
  dfsbcq(s0, cv(hs0), c0, w0)
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, cab(s0, w0))
  bitr2i(wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w0), wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s0, w0)), wsb(hs0, s0, w0))
  df-clab(hs0, s0, w0)
  ax-mp(wb(wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))
  equid(hs0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, cv(hs0), w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbc8g(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →([c0 / s0]w0 ↔ c0 ∈ { s0 | w0 }))
} = {
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, c1, [c0 / s0]w0, c0 ∈ { s0 | w0 }, [hs0 / s0]w0, hs0 ∈ { s0 | w0 })
  dfsbcq(s0, hs0, c0, w0)
  eleq1(hs0, c0, { s0 | w0 })
  bitr2i([hs0 / s0]w0, hs0 ∈ { s0 | w0 }, [hs0 / s0]w0)
  df-clab(hs0, s0, w0)
  ax-mp(([hs0 / s0]w0 ↔[hs0 / s0]w0), hs0 = hs0)
  equid(hs0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, hs0, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0]w0)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ { s0 | w0 })
}

blocks.name: sbc2or
blocks.content: The disjunction of two equivalences for class substitution does not require a class existence hypothesis. This theorem tells us that there are only 2 possibilities for ` [ A / x ] ph ` behavior at proper classes, matching the ~ sbc5 (false) and ~ sbc6 (true) conclusions. This is interesting since ~ dfsbcq and ~ dfsbcq2 (from which it is derived) do not appear to say anything obvious about proper class behavior. Note that this theorem does not tell us that it is always one or the other at proper classes; it could "flip" between false (the first disjunct) and true (the second disjunct) as a function of some other variable ` y ` that ` ph ` or ` A ` may contain. (Contributed by NM, 11-Oct-2004.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbc2or(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wo(wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  pm2.61i(wo(wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))), wcel(c0, universe))
  orcd(wcel(c0, universe), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))))
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0)))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  exbidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))
  anbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  eqeq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0))
  sb5(hs0, s0, w0)
  mpbii(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wo(wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))), wo(wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wn(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))))))
  pm5.15(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  orbi2d(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wn(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))))
  bibi2d(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wn(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  2thd(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wn(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  nexdv(s0, wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))
  con3i(wcel(c0, universe), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))
  adantr(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0, wcel(c0, universe))
  alrimiv(s0, wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))
  pm2.21d(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)
  con3i(wcel(c0, universe), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  mpbii(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cv(s0), universe))
  vex(s0)
  eleq1(cv(s0), c0, universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  diff.hs0.w(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wn.s(s0, wcel(c0, universe))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: sbcex
blocks.content: By our definition of proper substitution, it can only be true if the substituted expression is a set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: sbceq1a
blocks.content: Equality theorem for class substitution. Class version of ~ sbequ12 . (Contributed by NM, 26-Sep-2003.)

blocks.name: sbceq2a
blocks.content: Equality theorem for class substitution. Class version of ~ sbequ12r . (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: spsbc
blocks.content: Specialization: if a formula is true for all sets, it is true for any class which is a set. Similar to Theorem 6.11 of [Quine] p. 44. This is Frege's ninth axiom per Proposition 58 of [Frege1879] p. 51. See also ~ stdpc4 and ~ rspsbc . (Contributed by NM, 16-Jan-2004.)

blocks.name: spsbcd
blocks.content: Specialization: if a formula is true for all sets, it is true for any class which is a set. Similar to Theorem 6.11 of [Quine] p. 44. See also ~ stdpc4 and ~ rspsbc . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2017.)

blocks.name: sbcco
blocks.content: A composition law for class substitution. (Contributed by NM, 26-Sep-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcco(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)), wsbc(s1, c0, w0))
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wsbc(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)), wsbc(s1, c0, w0), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))
  sbcex(s1, c0, w0)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wsbc(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)), wsbc(s1, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)), wsbc(s1, cv(hs0), w0))
  dfsbcq(s0, cv(hs0), c0, wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))
  dfsbcq(s1, cv(hs0), c0, w0)
  bitri(wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)), wsbc(s1, cv(hs0), w0), wsb(hs0, s1, w0))
  3bitr3ri(wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)), wsb(hs0, s1, w0), wsb(hs0, s0, wsb(s0, s1, w0)), wsb(hs0, s0, wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)))
  sbbii(hs0, s0, wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))
  sbsbc(s0, s1, w0)
  sbco2(hs0, s0, s1, w0)
  nfv(s0, w0)
  sbsbc(hs0, s0, wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))
  sbsbc(hs0, s1, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s1, c0, w0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbcco(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ([c0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0 ↔[c0 / s1]w0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii([c0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0, [c0 / s1]w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, [s0 / s1]w0)
  sbcex(s1, c0, w0)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, [c0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0, [c0 / s1]w0, [hs0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0, [hs0 / s1]w0)
  dfsbcq(s0, hs0, c0, [s0 / s1]w0)
  dfsbcq(s1, hs0, c0, w0)
  bitri([hs0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0, [hs0 / s1]w0, [hs0 / s1]w0)
  3bitr3ri([hs0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0, [hs0 / s1]w0, [hs0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0, [hs0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0)
  sbbii(hs0, s0, [s0 / s1]w0, [s0 / s1]w0)
  sbsbc(s0, s1, w0)
  sbco2(hs0, s0, s1, w0)
  nfv(s0, w0)
  sbsbc(hs0, s0, [s0 / s1]w0)
  sbsbc(hs0, s1, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0][s0 / s1]w0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s1]w0)
}

blocks.name: sbcco2
blocks.content: A composition law for class substitution. Importantly, ` x ` may occur free in the class expression substituted for ` A ` . (Contributed by NM, 5-Sep-2004.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 8-Jun-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcco2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wsbc(s1, cv(s0), wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), wsbc(s0, c1, w0))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(c1, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  bitr3i(wsbc(s1, cv(s0), wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), wsbc(s0, c1, w0), wsb(s0, s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)))
  sbsbc(s0, s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  sbievw(s0, s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c1, w0))
  syl(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c1, w0)), wceq(c1, c0))
  equcoms(s1, s0, wceq(c1, c0))
  bicomd(wceq(c1, c0), wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c1, w0))
  dfsbcq(s0, c1, c0, w0)
  diff.wsbc.s(s1, s0, c1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbcco2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ([s0 / s1][c0 / s0]w0 ↔[c1 / s0]w0)
  ⊣ (s0 = s1 → c1 = c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  bitr3i([s0 / s1][c0 / s0]w0, [c1 / s0]w0, [s0 / s1][c0 / s0]w0)
  sbsbc(s0, s1, [c0 / s0]w0)
  sbievw(s0, s1, [c0 / s0]w0, [c1 / s0]w0)
  syl(s1 = s0, ([c0 / s0]w0 ↔[c1 / s0]w0), c1 = c0)
  equcoms(s1, s0, c1 = c0)
  bicomd(c1 = c0, [c0 / s0]w0, [c1 / s0]w0)
  dfsbcq(s0, c1, c0, w0)
  diff.wsbc.s(s1, s0, c1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: sbc5
blocks.content: An equivalence for class substitution. (Contributed by NM, 23-Aug-1993.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbc5(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, w0)
  sylibr(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wcel(c0, universe), wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  exsimpl(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)
  isset(s0, c0)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0)))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  exbidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0))
  anbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  eqeq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0))
  sb5(hs0, s0, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  diff.hs0.w(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbc5(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ([c0 / s0]w0 ↔ ∃(s0,(s0 = c0 ∧ w0)))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii([c0 / s0]w0, ∃(s0,(s0 = c0 ∧ w0)), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, w0)
  sylibr(∃(s0,(s0 = c0 ∧ w0)), c0 ∈ 𝕌, ∃(s0, s0 = c0))
  exsimpl(s0, s0 = c0, w0)
  isset(s0, c0)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, [c0 / s0]w0, ∃(s0,(s0 = c0 ∧ w0)), [hs0 / s0]w0, ∃(s0,(s0 = hs0 ∧ w0)))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  exbidv(s0, hs0 = c0, (s0 = hs0 ∧ w0), (s0 = c0 ∧ w0))
  anbi1d(hs0 = c0, s0 = hs0, w0, s0 = c0)
  eqeq2(hs0, c0, s0)
  sb5(hs0, s0, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0]w0)
  diff.hs0.w(∃(s0,(s0 = c0 ∧ w0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: sbciegft
blocks.content: Conversion of implicit substitution to explicit class substitution, using a bound-variable hypothesis instead of distinct variables. (Closed theorem version of ~ sbciegf .) (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbciegft(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0)))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w1), w0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  impbid(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0)))), wsbc(s0, c0, w1), w0)
  syl5bi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0)))), wsbc(s0, c0, w1), w0, wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1)))
  sbc5(s0, c0, w1)
  3adant1(wcel(c0, c1), wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))), wi(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1)), w0))
  sylan2(wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))), wi(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1)), w0), wal(s0, wi(wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1), w0)))
  alimi(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0)), wi(wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1), w0))
  impd(wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1, w0)
  imim2i(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0), wi(w1, w0))
  biimp(w1, w0)
  biimpa(wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1), w0)), wi(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1)), w0))
  19.23t(s0, w0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))
  sylibrd(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0)))), w0, wsbc(s0, c0, w1), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1)))
  3adant1(wcel(c0, c1), wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))))
  sylan2(wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))), wal(s0, wi(w0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))))
  alimi(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0)), wi(w0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1)))
  com23(wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0)), w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1)
  imim2i(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0), wi(w0, w1))
  biimpr(w1, w0)
  biimpa(wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(w0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))))
  19.21t(s0, w0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, c1), wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w1), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))))
  sbc6g(s0, c0, c1, w1)
}

blocks.name: sbcie2g
blocks.content: Conversion of implicit substitution to explicit class substitution. This version of ~ sbcie avoids a disjointness condition on ` x , A ` by substituting twice. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcie2g(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), w1))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wb(w2, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  vtoclbg(s1, c0, c1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0), w1, wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), w2)
  dfsbcq(s0, cv(s1), c0, w0)
  bitr3i(wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), w2, wsb(s1, s0, w0))
  sbsbc(s1, s0, w0)
  sbievw(s1, s0, w0, w2)
  diff.wsbc.s(s1, s0, c0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbcie2g(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →([c0 / s0]w0 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ (s0 = s1 →(w0 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (s1 = c0 →(w2 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w1)
} = {
  vtoclbg(s1, c0, c1, [c0 / s0]w0, w1, [s1 / s0]w0, w2)
  dfsbcq(s0, s1, c0, w0)
  bitr3i([s1 / s0]w0, w2, [s1 / s0]w0)
  sbsbc(s1, s0, w0)
  sbievw(s1, s0, w0, w2)
  diff.wsbc.s(s1, s0, c0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: sbcied2
blocks.content: Conversion of implicit substitution to explicit class substitution, deduction form. (Contributed by NM, 13-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcied2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w1), w2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c2)), wb(w1, w2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
} = {
  sbcied(s0, c0, c1, w0, w1, w2)
  syldan(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w2), wceq(cv(s0), c2))
  sylan9eqr(cv(s0), c2, c0, w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  id(wceq(cv(s0), c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbcied2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ⊢ (w0 →([c0 / s0]w1 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 = c2)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 = c2)→(w1 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
} = {
  sbcied(s0, c0, c1, w0, w1, w2)
  syldan(w0, s0 = c0, (w1 ↔ w2), s0 = c2)
  sylan9eqr(s0, c2, c0, w0, s0 = c0)
  id(s0 = c0)
}

blocks.name: elrabsf
blocks.content: Membership in a restricted class abstraction, expressed with explicit class substitution. (The variation ~ elrabf has implicit substitution). The hypothesis specifies that ` x ` must not be a free variable in ` B ` . (Contributed by NM, 30-Sep-2003.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm elrabsf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, crab(s0, c1, w0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wsbc(s0, c0, w0)))
  -| wnfc(s0, c1)
} = {
  elrab2(hs0, c0, crab(s0, c1, w0), c1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w0))
  dfsbcq(s0, cv(hs0), c0, w0)
  cbvrab(s0, hs0, c1, w0, wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w0))
  nfcv(hs0, c1)
  nfv(hs0, w0)
  nfsbc1v(s0, cv(hs0), w0)
  sbceq1a(s0, cv(hs0), w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elrabsf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c1 | w0 } ↔(c0 ∈ c1 ∧[c0 / s0]w0))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c1)
} = {
  elrab2(hs0, c0, { s0 ∈ c1 | w0 }, c1, [c0 / s0]w0, [hs0 / s0]w0)
  dfsbcq(s0, hs0, c0, w0)
  cbvrab(s0, hs0, c1, w0, [hs0 / s0]w0)
  nfcv(hs0, c1)
  nfv(hs0, w0)
  nfsbc1v(s0, hs0, w0)
  sbceq1a(s0, hs0, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0]w0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: eqsbc3
blocks.content: Substitution applied to an atomic wff. Class version of ~ eqsb3 . (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 29-Jun-2011.) Avoid ~ ax-13 . (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 29-Apr-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm eqsbc3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, c1, wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, c2), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), wceq(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  dfsbcq(s0, cv(hs0), c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2))
  eqeq1(cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  bitr3i(wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), wceq(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wsb(hs0, s0, wceq(cv(s0), c2)))
  sbsbc(hs0, s0, wceq(cv(s0), c2))
  eqsb3(hs0, s0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2)))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(c0, c2))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm eqsbc3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →([c0 / s0]s0 = c2 ↔ c0 = c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, c1, [c0 / s0]s0 = c2, c0 = c2, [hs0 / s0]s0 = c2, hs0 = c2)
  dfsbcq(s0, hs0, c0, s0 = c2)
  eqeq1(hs0, c0, c2)
  bitr3i([hs0 / s0]s0 = c2, hs0 = c2, [hs0 / s0]s0 = c2)
  sbsbc(hs0, s0, s0 = c2)
  eqsb3(hs0, s0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0]s0 = c2)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 = c2)
}

blocks.name: sbcan
blocks.content: Distribution of class substitution over conjunction. (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-2016.) (Revised by NM, 17-Aug-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcan(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wa(w0, w1)), wa(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1)))
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wsbc(s0, c0, wa(w0, w1)), wa(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1)), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, wa(w0, w1))
  adantl(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, w1)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wsbc(s0, c0, wa(w0, w1)), wa(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1)), wsb(hs0, s0, wa(w0, w1)), wa(wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsb(hs0, s0, w1)))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, wa(w0, w1))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsb(hs0, s0, w1), wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w1)
  sban(hs0, s0, w0, w1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, wa(w0, w1)))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbcan(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ ([c0 / s0](w0 ∧ w1)↔([c0 / s0]w0 ∧[c0 / s0]w1))
} = {
  pm5.21nii([c0 / s0](w0 ∧ w1), ([c0 / s0]w0 ∧[c0 / s0]w1), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, (w0 ∧ w1))
  adantl([c0 / s0]w0, [c0 / s0]w1, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, w1)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, [c0 / s0](w0 ∧ w1), ([c0 / s0]w0 ∧[c0 / s0]w1), [hs0 / s0](w0 ∧ w1), ([hs0 / s0]w0 ∧[hs0 / s0]w1))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, (w0 ∧ w1))
  anbi12d(hs0 = c0, [hs0 / s0]w0, [hs0 / s0]w1, [c0 / s0]w0, [c0 / s0]w1)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w1)
  sban(hs0, s0, w0, w1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0](w0 ∧ w1))
  diff.hs0.w(([c0 / s0]w0 ∧[c0 / s0]w1))
}

blocks.name: sbcor
blocks.content: Distribution of class substitution over disjunction. (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-2016.) (Revised by NM, 17-Aug-2018.)

thm sbcor(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0, wff w1) {

} = {
  pm5.21nii(wsbc(s0, c0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1)), wcel(c0, universe))

  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wsbc(s0, c0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1)), wsb(hs0, s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsb(hs0, s0, w1)))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, wo(w0, w1))
  orbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsb(hs0, s0, w1), wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w1))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w1)

thm sbcor(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0, wff w1) {

  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, (w0 ∨ w1))
  orbi12d(hs0 = c0, [hs0 / s0]w0, [hs0 / s0]w1, [c0 / s0]w0, [c0 / s0]w1)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w1)
  sbor(hs0, s0, w0, w1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)

}

blocks.name: sbcal
blocks.content: Move universal quantifier in and out of class substitution. (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-2016.) (Revised by NM, 18-Aug-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcal(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wsbc(s0, c0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, wal(s1, w0))
  sps(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, w0)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wsbc(s0, c0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), wsb(hs0, s0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wsb(hs0, s0, w0)))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, wal(s1, w0))
  albidv(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  sbal(hs0, s0, s1, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, wal(s1, w0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wal(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbcal(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ([c0 / s0]∀(s1, w0)↔ ∀(s1,[c0 / s0]w0))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii([c0 / s0]∀(s1, w0), ∀(s1,[c0 / s0]w0), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, ∀(s1, w0))
  sps(s1, [c0 / s0]w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, w0)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, [c0 / s0]∀(s1, w0), ∀(s1,[c0 / s0]w0), [hs0 / s0]∀(s1, w0), ∀(s1,[hs0 / s0]w0))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, ∀(s1, w0))
  albidv(s1, hs0 = c0, [hs0 / s0]w0, [c0 / s0]w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  sbal(hs0, s0, s1, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0]∀(s1, w0))
  diff.hs0.w(∀(s1,[c0 / s0]w0))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: sbcex2
blocks.content: Move existential quantifier in and out of class substitution. (Contributed by NM, 21-May-2004.) (Revised by NM, 18-Aug-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcex2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wex(s1, w0)), wex(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wsbc(s0, c0, wex(s1, w0)), wex(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, wex(s1, w0))
  exlimiv(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, w0)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wsbc(s0, c0, wex(s1, w0)), wex(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), wsb(hs0, s0, wex(s1, w0)), wex(s1, wsb(hs0, s0, w0)))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, wex(s1, w0))
  exbidv(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  sbex(hs0, s0, s1, w0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, wex(s1, w0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wex(s1, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbcex2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ([c0 / s0]∃(s1, w0)↔ ∃(s1,[c0 / s0]w0))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii([c0 / s0]∃(s1, w0), ∃(s1,[c0 / s0]w0), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, ∃(s1, w0))
  exlimiv(s1, [c0 / s0]w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, w0)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, [c0 / s0]∃(s1, w0), ∃(s1,[c0 / s0]w0), [hs0 / s0]∃(s1, w0), ∃(s1,[hs0 / s0]w0))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, ∃(s1, w0))
  exbidv(s1, hs0 = c0, [hs0 / s0]w0, [c0 / s0]w0)

  sbex(hs0, s0, s1, w0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, universe)

blocks.name: sbceqal
blocks.content: Class version of one implication of ~ equvelv . (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 28-Jun-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbceqal(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  sylibd(wcel(c0, c1), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, c2), wsbc(s0, c0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c2))))
  spsbc(s0, c0, c1, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c2)))
  3bitrd(wcel(c0, c1), wsbc(s0, c0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, c2), wi(wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2))), wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2)))
  sbcimg(s0, c0, c1, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c2))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wi(wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2))), wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2))), wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  mpbiri(wcel(c0, c1), wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(c0, c0))
  eqid(c0)
  eqsbc3(s0, c0, c1, c0)
  pm5.5(wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wsbc(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2)))
  eqsbc3(s0, c0, c1, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbceqal(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(∀(s0,(s0 = c0 → s0 = c2))→ c0 = c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  sylibd(c0 ∈ c1, ∀(s0,(s0 = c0 → s0 = c2)), c0 = c2, [c0 / s0](s0 = c0 → s0 = c2))
  spsbc(s0, c0, c1, (s0 = c0 → s0 = c2))
  3bitrd(c0 ∈ c1, [c0 / s0](s0 = c0 → s0 = c2), c0 = c2, ([c0 / s0]s0 = c0 →[c0 / s0]s0 = c2), [c0 / s0]s0 = c2)
  sbcimg(s0, c0, c1, s0 = c0, s0 = c2)
  syl(c0 ∈ c1, (([c0 / s0]s0 = c0 →[c0 / s0]s0 = c2)↔[c0 / s0]s0 = c2), [c0 / s0]s0 = c0)
  mpbiri(c0 ∈ c1, [c0 / s0]s0 = c0, c0 = c0)
  eqid(c0)
  eqsbc3(s0, c0, c1, c0)
  pm5.5([c0 / s0]s0 = c0, [c0 / s0]s0 = c2)
  eqsbc3(s0, c0, c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: sbcel1v
blocks.content: Class substitution into a membership relation. (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-2018.) Avoid ~ ax-13 . (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 30-Apr-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcel1v(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c0, c1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wsbc(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, universe))
  sbcex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  elex(c0, c1)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wsbc(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c0, c1), wsb(hs0, s0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  clelsb3(hs0, s0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbcel1v(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ([c0 / s0]s0 ∈ c1 ↔ c0 ∈ c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  pm5.21nii([c0 / s0]s0 ∈ c1, c0 ∈ c1, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbcex(s0, c0, s0 ∈ c1)
  elex(c0, c1)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, [c0 / s0]s0 ∈ c1, c0 ∈ c1, [hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ c1, hs0 ∈ c1)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, s0 ∈ c1)
  eleq1(hs0, c0, c1)
  clelsb3(hs0, s0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0]s0 ∈ c1)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ c1)
}

blocks.name: sbcel2gv
blocks.content: Class substitution into a membership relation. (Contributed by NM, 17-Nov-2006.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 29-Jun-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbcel2gv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wcel(c2, cv(s0))), wcel(c2, c0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  sbcie2g(s0, hs0, c0, c1, wcel(c2, cv(s0)), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, cv(hs0)))
  eleq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c2)
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c2, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c2, cv(s0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c2, c0))
}

blocks.name: sbc2iegf
blocks.content: Conversion of implicit substitution to explicit class substitution. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Dec-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbc2iegf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, c2, w0)), w1))
  -| wnf(s0, w1)
  -| wnf(s1, w1)
  -| wnf(s0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c2)), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  sbciedf(s0, c0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wsbc(s1, c2, w0), w1)
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))
  adantll(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(wsbc(s1, c2, w0), w1))
  sbciedf(s1, c2, c3, wa(wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cv(s0), c0)), w0, w1)
  simpl(wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  adantll(wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c2), wb(w0, w1))
  nfv(s1, wa(wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wnf(s1, w1))
  nfan(s0, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))
  nfv(s0, wcel(c0, c1))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wnf(s0, w1))
  diff.wa.s(s1, wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c2, c3)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbc2iegf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3)→([c0 / s0][c2 / s1]w0 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ F/(s0, w1)
  ⊣ F/(s1, w1)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c2 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ ((s0 = c0 ∧ s1 = c2)→(w0 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  sbciedf(s0, c0, c1, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3), [c2 / s1]w0, w1)
  simpl(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3)
  adantll(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3, s0 = c0, ([c2 / s1]w0 ↔ w1))
  sbciedf(s1, c2, c3, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ s0 = c0), w0, w1)
  simpl(c2 ∈ c3, s0 = c0)
  adantll(c2 ∈ c3, s0 = c0, s1 = c2, (w0 ↔ w1))
  nfv(s1, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ s0 = c0))
  a1i((c2 ∈ c3 ∧ s0 = c0), F/(s1, w1))
  nfan(s0, c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3)
  nfv(s0, c0 ∈ c1)
  a1i((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3), F/(s0, w1))
  diff.wa.s(s1, c2 ∈ c3, s0 = c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c2, c3)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, s0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: sbc2ie
blocks.content: Conversion of implicit substitution to explicit class substitution. (Contributed by NM, 16-Dec-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Dec-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbc2ie(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, c1, w0)), w1)
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
  -| wi(wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c1)), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  mp2an(wb(wsbc(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, c1, w0)), w1), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  sbc2iegf(s0, s1, c0, universe, c1, universe, w0, w1)
  nfv(s0, w1)

  ralbid(s0, c2, (F/(s0, c0)∧ hs0 = c0), [hs0 / s1]w0, [c0 / s1]w0)

  3bitr4g(wa(wnfc(s0, c0), wcel(c0, universe)), wsbc(s1, c0, wrex(s0, c1, w0)), wrex(s0, c1, wsbc(s1, c0, w0)), wsbc(s1, c0, wn(wral(s0, c1, wn(w0)))), wn(wral(s0, c1, wn(wsbc(s1, c0, w0)))))
  bitrd(wa(wnfc(s0, c0), wcel(c0, universe)), wsbc(s1, c0, wn(wral(s0, c1, wn(w0)))), wn(wral(s0, c1, wn(wsbc(s1, c0, w0)))), wn(wsbc(s1, c0, wral(s0, c1, wn(w0)))))
  adantl(wnfc(s0, c0), wcel(c0, universe), wb(wsbc(s1, c0, wn(wral(s0, c1, wn(w0)))), wn(wsbc(s1, c0, wral(s0, c1, wn(w0))))))

  bitrd(wa(wnfc(s0, c0), wcel(c0, universe)), wsbc(s1, c0, wral(s0, c1, wn(w0))), wral(s0, c1, wn(wsbc(s1, c0, w0))), wral(s0, c1, wsbc(s1, c0, wn(w0))))
  ancoms(wnfc(s0, c0), wcel(c0, universe), wb(wsbc(s1, c0, wral(s0, c1, wn(w0))), wral(s0, c1, wsbc(s1, c0, wn(w0)))))
  sbcralt(s0, s1, c0, universe, c1, wn(w0))
  ralbid(s0, c1, wa(wnfc(s0, c0), wcel(c0, universe)), wsbc(s1, c0, wn(w0)), wn(wsbc(s1, c0, w0)))
  nfan1(s0, wnfc(s0, c0), wcel(c0, universe))

thm reu8nf(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wb(wreu(s0, c0, w0), wrex(s0, c0, wa(w0, wral(s1, c0, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))))
  -| wnf(s0, w1)
  -| wnf(s0, w2)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wb(w0, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wb(w2, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w2)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w1)
} = {
  3bitri(wreu(s0, c0, w0), wrex(s0, c0, wa(w0, wral(s1, c0, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))), wreu(s2, c0, w2), wrex(s2, c0, wa(w2, wral(s1, c0, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))))
  cbvreu(s0, s2, c0, w0, w2)

  nfan(s0, w2, wral(s1, c0, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
  nfral(s0, s1, c0, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))))
  nfcv(s0, c0)
  nfim(s0, w1, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))

  equcoms(s2, s0, wb(w2, w0))

  ralbidv(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wi(w1, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))), wi(w1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), w1, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))

  diff.wral.s(s2, s1, c0, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))

  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s2), cv(s0))

thm reu8nf(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ⊢ (∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0)↔ ∃(s0 ∈ c0,(w0 ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(w1 → s0 = s1)))))
  ⊣ F/(s0, w1)

  3bitri(∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0), ∃(s0 ∈ c0,(w0 ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(w1 → s0 = s1)))), ∃!(s2 ∈ c0, w2), ∃(s2 ∈ c0,(w2 ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(w1 → s2 = s1)))))

  bicomd(s0 = s2, w2, w0)
  ralbidv(s1, c0, s2 = s0, (w1 → s2 = s1), (w1 → s0 = s1))
  imbi2d(s2 = s0, w1, s2 = s1, s0 = s1)
  equequ1(s2, s0, s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, s2, s1)

  diff.wi.s(s2, w1, s0 = s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s2, s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)

  diffss.ex(s2, s1)

thm sbcabel(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →([c0 / s0]{ s1 | w0 } ∈ c2 ↔ { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 } ∈ c2))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl(c0 ∈ c1, ([c0 / s0]{ s1 | w0 } ∈ c2 ↔ { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 } ∈ c2), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  elex(c0, c1)
  3bitr4g(c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0]{ s1 | w0 } ∈ c2, { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 } ∈ c2, [c0 / s0]∃(hs0,(hs0 = { s1 | w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2)), ∃(hs0,(hs0 = { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2)))
  syl5bb(c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0]∃(hs0,(hs0 = { s1 | w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2)), ∃(hs0,(hs0 = { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2)), ∃(hs0,[c0 / s0](hs0 = { s1 | w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2)))
  sbcex2(s0, hs0, c0, (hs0 = { s1 | w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2))
  exbidv(hs0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0](hs0 = { s1 | w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2), (hs0 = { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2))
  syl5bb(c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0](hs0 = { s1 | w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2), (hs0 = { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2), ([c0 / s0]hs0 = { s1 | w0 } ∧[c0 / s0]hs0 ∈ c2))
  sbcan(s0, c0, hs0 = { s1 | w0 }, hs0 ∈ c2)
  anbi12d(c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0]hs0 = { s1 | w0 }, [c0 / s0]hs0 ∈ c2, hs0 = { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 }, hs0 ∈ c2)
  3bitr4g(c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0]hs0 = { s1 | w0 }, hs0 = { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 }, [c0 / s0]∀(s1,(s1 ∈ hs0 ↔ w0)), ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ hs0 ↔[c0 / s0]w0)))
  syl5bb(c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0]∀(s1,(s1 ∈ hs0 ↔ w0)), ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ hs0 ↔[c0 / s0]w0)), ∀(s1,[c0 / s0](s1 ∈ hs0 ↔ w0)))
  sbcal(s0, s1, c0, (s1 ∈ hs0 ↔ w0))
  albidv(s1, c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0](s1 ∈ hs0 ↔ w0), (s1 ∈ hs0 ↔[c0 / s0]w0))
  bitrd(c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0](s1 ∈ hs0 ↔ w0), (s1 ∈ hs0 ↔[c0 / s0]w0), ([c0 / s0]s1 ∈ hs0 ↔[c0 / s0]w0))
  sbcbig(s0, c0, universe, s1 ∈ hs0, w0)
  bibi1d(c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0]s1 ∈ hs0, [c0 / s0]w0, s1 ∈ hs0)
  sbcg(s0, c0, universe, s1 ∈ hs0)
  sbcbii(s0, c0, hs0 = { s1 | w0 }, ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ hs0 ↔ w0)))
  abeq2(s1, hs0, w0)
  abeq2(s1, hs0, [c0 / s0]w0)
  sbcgf(s0, c0, universe, hs0 ∈ c2)
  nfcri(s0, hs0, c2)
  sbcbii(s0, c0, { s1 | w0 } ∈ c2, ∃(hs0,(hs0 = { s1 | w0 } ∧ hs0 ∈ c2)))
  df-clel(hs0, { s1 | w0 }, c2)
  df-clel(hs0, { s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 }, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, s1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c({ s1 | w0 })
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c({ s1 |[c0 / s0]w0 })
}

blocks.name: rspsbc
blocks.content: Restricted quantifier version of Axiom 4 of [Mendelson] p. 69. This provides an axiom for a predicate calculus for a restricted domain. This theorem generalizes the unrestricted ~ stdpc4 and ~ spsbc . See also ~ rspsbca and ~ rspcsbela . (Contributed by NM, 17-Nov-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: rspsbca
blocks.content: Restricted quantifier version of Axiom 4 of [Mendelson] p. 69. (Contributed by NM, 14-Dec-2005.)

blocks.name: rspesbca

blocks.name: ra4v
blocks.content: Version of ~ ra4 with a disjoint variable condition, requiring fewer axioms. This is ~ stdpc5v for a restricted domain. (Contributed by BJ, 27-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: ra4
blocks.content: Restricted quantifier version of Axiom 5 of [Mendelson] p. 69. This is the axiom ~ stdpc5 of standard predicate calculus for a restricted domain. See ~ ra4v for a version requiring fewer axioms. (Contributed by NM, 16-Jan-2004.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 27-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: rmo2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of restricted "at most one." Note that ` E* x e. A ph ` is not equivalent to ` E. y e. A A. x e. A ( ph -> x = y ) ` (in analogy to ~ reu6 ); to see this, let ` A ` be the empty set. However, one direction of this pattern holds; see ~ rmo2i . (Contributed by NM, 17-Jun-2017.)

thm rmob(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(wa(wrmo(s0, c0, w0), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1)), wb(wceq(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c2, c0), w2)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wb(w0, w1))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wb(w0, w2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
} = {
  sylanb(wrmo(s0, c0, w0), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1), wb(wceq(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c2, c0), w2)), wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  df-rmo(s0, c0, w0)
  pm5.21ndd(wa(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1)), wceq(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c2, c0), w2), wcel(c2, c0))
  syl5ibcom(wa(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1)), wceq(c1, c2), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c1, c0))
  eleq1(c1, c2, c0)
  a1i(wa(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1)), wi(wa(wcel(c2, c0), w2), wcel(c2, c0)))
  simpl(wcel(c2, c0), w2)
  ex(wa(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1)), wcel(c2, c0), wb(wceq(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c2, c0), w2)))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wb(wceq(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c2, c0), w2)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1))
  anim1i(wa(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1)), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c1, c0))
  simprl(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wcel(c1, c0), w1)
  simpll(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1), wcel(c2, c0))
  simplr(wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1), wcel(c2, c0))
  mob(s0, c1, c0, c2, c0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0), wa(wcel(c1, c0), w1), wa(wcel(c2, c0), w2))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0, wcel(c1, c0), w1)
  eleq1(cv(s0), c1, c0)
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0, wcel(c2, c0), w2)
  eleq1(cv(s0), c2, c0)

blocks.name: rmob2
blocks.content: Consequence of "restricted at most one." (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 9-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm rmob2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w2, w1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wrmo(s0, c1, w2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  -| wi(w0, w2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
} = {
  mpbirand(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0), w1, wcel(c0, c1))
  syl112anc(w0, wb(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), w1)), wcel(c0, c1), wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w2)), wcel(cv(s0), c1), w2)
  sylib(w0, wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w2)), wrmo(s0, c1, w2))
  df-rmo(s0, c1, w2)
  mob2(s0, c0, c1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w2), wa(wcel(c0, c1), w1))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1), w2, wcel(c0, c1), w1)
  eleq1(cv(s0), c0, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, c1), w1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm rmob2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 = c0 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ (s0 = c0 →(w2 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → ∃*(s0 ∈ c1, w2))
  ⊣ (w0 → s0 ∈ c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → w2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w1)
} = {
  mpbirand(w0, s0 = c0, w1, c0 ∈ c1)
  syl112anc(w0, (s0 = c0 ↔(c0 ∈ c1 ∧ w1)), c0 ∈ c1, ∃*(s0,(s0 ∈ c1 ∧ w2)), s0 ∈ c1, w2)
  sylib(w0, ∃*(s0,(s0 ∈ c1 ∧ w2)), ∃*(s0 ∈ c1, w2))
  df-rmo(s0, c1, w2)
  mob2(s0, c0, c1, (s0 ∈ c1 ∧ w2), (c0 ∈ c1 ∧ w1))
  anbi12d(s0 = c0, s0 ∈ c1, w2, c0 ∈ c1, w1)
  eleq1(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, c0 ∈ c1, w1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: rmoi2
blocks.content: Consequence of "restricted at most one." (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 9-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm rmoi2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wrmo(s0, c1, w1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  -| wi(w0, w1)
  -| wi(w0, w2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0), w2)
  rmob2(s0, c0, c1, w0, w2, w1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm rmoi2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ⊢ (w0 → s0 = c0)
  ⊣ (s0 = c0 →(w1 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → ∃*(s0 ∈ c1, w1))
  ⊣ (w0 → s0 ∈ c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → w1)
  ⊣ (w0 → w2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, s0 = c0, w2)
  rmob2(s0, c0, c1, w0, w2, w1)
}

blocks.name: 2reu2
blocks.content: Double restricted existential uniqueness, analogous to ~ 2eu2 . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 29-Jun-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2reu2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wreu(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0)), wb(wreu(s1, c1, wreu(s0, c0, w0)), wreu(s1, c1, wrex(s0, c0, w0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  impbid(wreu(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0)), wreu(s1, c1, wreu(s0, c0, w0)), wreu(s1, c1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)))
  3syl(wreu(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0)), wi(wreu(s1, c1, wreu(s0, c0, w0)), wreu(s1, c1, wrex(s0, c0, w0))), wrmo(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0)), wral(s1, c1, wrmo(s0, c0, w0)))
  reurmo(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0))
  2rmorex(s0, s1, c0, c1, w0)
  syl6bi(wral(s1, c1, wrmo(s0, c0, w0)), wreu(s1, c1, wreu(s0, c0, w0)), wreu(s1, c1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), wa(wreu(s1, c1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), wreu(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0))))
  2reu1(s1, s0, c1, c0, w0)
  simpl(wreu(s1, c1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), wreu(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0)))
  expcom(wreu(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0)), wreu(s1, c1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), wreu(s1, c1, wreu(s0, c0, w0)))
  2rexreu(s1, s0, c1, c0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
